alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 4:24AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Laurel, northwestern Owsley, Jackson, northeastern Rockcastle and northwestern Clay Counties through 500 AM EDT... At 424 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Robinet, or 9 miles west of McKee, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Middlefork, Carico and Eberle around 430 AM EDT. Shop Branch, Hurley, Deese, Parrot, Waneta and Peoples around 435 AM EDT. McKee, Atkinstown, Olin, Dabolt, Bradshaw, Bond, Cornelius, Macedonia and Moores Creek around 440 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mildred, Gray Hawk, Settle Store, Privett, Annville, Welchburg, Green Hill, Turkey Foot, New Zion, Royrader, Herd, Zekes Point, Maulden, Tyner, Mummie, Egypt, Shepherdtown, High Knob, Datha, Nathanton, Elian, Green Hall and Malcomb. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
